definition: to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: By the seventh day, Felix, accepting his fate, no longer begged for mercy.
sentences.chinese: 第七天，费利克斯认命了，不再祈求宽恕。

sentences.english: Resign to my fate, and face the world with a smile, and not make myself miserable.
sentences.chinese: 认命，也潇洒地以微笑来面对，不要让自己痛苦。

sentences.english: If he leaves, I can only accept reality and.
Mr. Meant-to has a friend, his name is Didn't-Do.
sentences.chinese: “认命”先生有一位朋友，他的名字叫“别干”。

sentences.english: Please note that appointments of many of the positions are made between June and August.
sentences.chinese: 请注意很多职位的认命是六月到八月完成的。

sentences.english: In summer, people dress in casual clothes, like T-shirts and shorts.
sentences.chinese: 夏天，认命都穿休闲服装，例如短裤。

sentences.english: I named all, change is the reality.
sentences.chinese: 我认命所有的一切，改变不了的就是现实。

sentences.english: Many people think that they have to accept whatever life throws at them.
sentences.chinese: 许多人认为人应该认命接受生活抛给自己的一切。

definition: to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
to comfort oneself/to console oneself/to reassure oneself
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
as matters stand/things having reached this stage
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
